question: In the Indian Constitution, the Right to Equality is granted by Five Articles. Which of the following are those articles?
explanation: Here are 6 groups of Fundamental Rights: Right to Equality (14-18), Right to Freedom (19-22), Right against Exploitation (23 and 24), Right to Freedom of Religion (25 and 28), Cultural & Educational Rights (29 and 30), and Right to Constitutional remedies (32).
